roleset.name: to answer successfully or put into action (incl. sports)

role.descr: question, proposal, thing put into action

example.name: passive
example.text: Then , in 1988 , a proposal to keep better track of income by selling prepaid cards for pachinko was fielded in parliament .

propbank.arg: a proposal to keep better track of income by selling prepaid cards for pachinko

example.name: transitive
example.text: He puts in busy six - day weeks ( excluding game days ) , and on one recent afternoon fielded questions , in the course of an hour , from a TV producer , his luxury - suite marketing manager , a disgruntled customer and a roomful of Arkansas reporters .

propbank.arg: from a TV producer , his luxury - suite marketing manager , a disgruntled customer and a roomful of Arkansas reporters
in the course of an hour

example.name: put a ball into action by catching it on the field
example.text: Midmorning , he dons an orange - and - blue uniform and , for fun , may field a bunt from Dave Kingman .

roleset.note: FIELD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'field' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from field.01-v predicate notes)
